posts.name: Jaci
posts.cooked:
Interesting, are you talking about connection via GrappleHook? That has to be done over USB even if you’re connected via the radio, but the presence of the radio shouldn’t affect it. The CAN bridge specifically binds to USB, so the radio shouldn’t matter at all.

Are you using the Grapple Hook daemon deployment or in user code?

posts.name: Jaci
posts.cooked:
Ah, just noticed you originally mentioned this in Sept of last year. The radio isn’t the source of the issue here, there’s a bit of a problem with how the rio deals with non-user applications that we’re still fixing - in the latest version of GrappleHook that we released a few weeks ago, it has instructions on how to make a more reliable connection by skipping the daemon altogether by adding a line to your robot code. Going forward, that’s the recommended method since it also doesn’t suspend your robot code.

I’ll get the docs amended, but in the mean time update your GrappleHook and follow the instructions within

Thanks, Jaci

posts.name: kuzey
posts.cooked: Is there any way to configure LaserCAN without connecting to the roborio via a usb cable(we broke our usb port) maybe via the Ethernet cable or with using a Ethernet to usb adapter?

For what’s it’s worth, if you have a mentor post on this NI forum, it is very likely your Rio can be sent in for servicing or can be replaced.

https://forums.ni.com/t5/Troubleshooting-Hardware/bd-p/TroubleshootingHardware

posts.name: Jaci
posts.cooked: Not currently, but I might see if I can deploy a new release that we can configure over ethernet soon to cover this use case

posts.name: Jaci
posts.cooked: Unfortunately the USB IP on the RoboRIO is pretty specific and can’t be easily changed to an ethernet device. I’ll see if I can get a release rolled tonight

accepted_answer.excerpt:
There’s a bit to unpack here, but firstly your robot class shouldn’t be named “laserCan” - it should pretty much be identical to what WPILib generates with the addition of a LaserCAN object initialised within it and a call to CanBridge.runTCP(). 
If the connection is because the target machine is ac…
